required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Microtransplantation With Decitabine and Cytarabine Improves Patient Outcomes in Myelodysplastic Syndromes

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Hospital of the Chinese Academy of Military Medical Sciences

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Hospital of the Chinese Academy of Military Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether infusion of G-CSF mobilized HLA-mismatched peripheral blood stem cells (G-PBSC) combining decitabine and cytarabine chemotherapy can improve outcomes in myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) patients.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

arm_group.description: decitabine 25-30 mg/m2 daily for 4 days with cytarabine 100-150 mg/m2 daily for 7 days

intervention.description: Infusion of G-CSF mobilized HLA-mismatched peripheral blood stem cells (G-PBSC)

overall_official.affiliation: Affiliated Hospital of Academy of Military Medical Sciences

facility.name: Affiliated Hospital of Academy of Military Medical Sciences

reference.citation: Guo M, Hu KX, Yu CL, Sun QY, Qiao JH, Wang DH, Liu GX, Sun WJ, Wei L, Sun XD, Huang YJ, Qiao JX, Dong Z, Ai HS. Infusion of HLA-mismatched peripheral blood stem cells improves the outcome of chemotherapy for acute myeloid leukemia in elderly patients. Blood. 2011 Jan 20;117(3):936-41. Epub 2010 Oct 21.
